name: Fighter
description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

1.name: Fighting Style
1.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

options.name: Archery
options.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

options.name: Defense
options.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

options.name: Dueling
options.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

options.name: Great Weapon Fighting
options.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

options.name: Protection
options.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

options.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
options.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

1.name: Second Wind
1.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm.

2.name: Action Surge
2.description: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

3.name: Martial Archetype
3.description: You choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Ability Score Improvement
6.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

7.name: Martial Archetype Feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

9.name: Indomitable
9.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.

10.name: Martial Archetype Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

11.name: Extra Attack (2)
11.description: You can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

13.name: Indomitable (two uses)
13.description: You can now use Indomitable twice between long rests.

14.name: Ability Score Improvement
14.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

15.name: Martial Archetype Feature
15.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

17.name: Indomitable (three uses)
17.description: You can now use Indomitable three times between long rests.

18.name: Martial Archetype Feature
18.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

20.name: Extra Attack (3)
20.description: You can attack four times, instead of three, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclasses.name: Martial Archetype
subclasses.description: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques.

options.name: Champion
options.description: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection.

3.name: Improved Critical
3.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

7.name: Remarkable Athlete
7.description: You can add half your proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus.

10.name: Additional Fighting Style
10.description: You can choose a second option from the Fighting Style class feature.

15.name: Superior Critical
15.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

18.name: Survivor
18.description: At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points if you have no more than half of your hit points left.

options.name: Echo Knight
options.description: A fighter who has mastered the art of using dunamis to summon echoes of their own potential from other timelines.

3.name: Manifest Echo
3.description: You can use a bonus action to magically manifest an echo of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you.

3.name: Unleash Incarnation
3.description: You can channel the power of your echo to make additional attacks.

7.name: Echo Avatar
7.description: You can temporarily transfer your consciousness to your echo.

10.name: Shadow Martyr
10.description: You can use your echo to protect your allies.

15.name: Reclaim Potential
15.description: You've learned to absorb the fleeting magic of your echo.

18.name: Legion of One
18.description: You can create multiple echoes of yourself.

options.name: Arcane Archer
options.description: An eldritch knight who combines arcane magic with archery to create magical arrows that seek their targets with supernatural accuracy.

3.name: Arcane Archer Lore
3.description: You learn magical theory and arcane archery techniques.

3.name: Arcane Shot
3.description: You learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots.

7.name: Curving Shot
7.description: You learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target.

7.name: Magic Arrow
7.description: You gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic.

15.name: Ever-Ready Shot
15.description: Your magical archery is available whenever battle starts.

18.name: Improved Shots
18.description: Your Arcane Shot options now deal more damage.

options.name: Cavalier
options.description: A warrior skilled at mounted combat and protecting allies, inspired by knights and similar mounted warriors.

3.name: Bonus Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion.

3.name: Born to the Saddle
3.description: Your mastery as a rider becomes apparent.

3.name: Unwavering Mark
3.description: You can mark creatures with your presence, protecting your allies.

7.name: Warding Maneuver
7.description: You learn to use your shield to protect your allies.

10.name: Hold the Line
10.description: You become a master of locking down your enemies.

15.name: Ferocious Charger
15.description: You master the art of the devastating charge.

18.name: Vigilant Defender
18.description: You respond to danger with extraordinary vigilance.

options.name: Samurai
options.description: A fighter who draws on an implacable fighting spirit to overcome enemies.

3.name: Bonus Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

3.name: Fighting Spirit
3.description: Your intensity in battle can shield you and help you strike true.

7.name: Elegant Courtier
7.description: Your discipline and attention to etiquette allows you to excel in social situations.

10.name: Tireless Spirit
10.description: Your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death.

15.name: Rapid Strike
15.description: You learn to trade advantage for an extra strike.

18.name: Strength before Death
18.description: Your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death.

options.name: Psi Warrior
options.description: A fighter who combines the power of the mind with martial combat prowess.

3.name: Psionic Power
3.description: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself.

7.name: Telekinetic Adept
7.description: You have mastered new ways to use your telekinetic abilities.

10.name: Guarded Mind
10.description: You have secured your mind against outside influence.

15.name: Bulwark of Force
15.description: You can shield yourself and others with telekinetic force.

18.name: Telekinetic Master
18.description: Your ability to move creatures and objects with your mind is matched by few.

options.name: Battle Master
options.description: Those who emulate the Battle Master archetype employ martial techniques passed down through generations, combining martial prowess with tactical acumen.

3.name: Combat Superiority
3.description: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

options.name: Commander's Strike
options.description: When you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike.

options.name: Disarming Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target.

options.name: Distracting Strike
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature.

options.name: Evasive Footwork
options.description: When you move, you can expend one superiority die, adding the number rolled to your AC until you stop moving.

options.name: Feinting Attack
options.description: You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action to feint.

options.name: Goading Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target.

options.name: Lunging Attack
options.description: When you make a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach.

options.name: Maneuvering Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position.

options.name: Menacing Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target.

options.name: Parry
options.description: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage.

options.name: Precision Attack
options.description: When you make a weapon attack roll, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll.

options.name: Pushing Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back.

options.name: Rally
options.description: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions.

options.name: Riposte
options.description: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack.

options.name: Sweeping Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature.

options.name: Trip Attack
options.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down.

3.name: Student of War
3.description: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

7.name: Know Your Enemy
7.description: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities.

10.name: Improved Combat Superiority
10.description: Your superiority dice turn into d10s.

15.name: Relentless
15.description: When you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain one superiority die.

18.name: Improved Combat Superiority
18.description: Your superiority dice turn into d12s.

options.name: Eldritch Knight
options.description: The archetypal Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic.

3.name: Spellcasting
3.description: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells.

3.name: Weapon Bond
3.description: You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon.

7.name: War Magic
7.description: When you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

10.name: Eldritch Strike
10.description: You learn how to make your weapon strikes undercut a creature's resistance to your spells.

15.name: Arcane Charge
15.description: You gain the ability to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see when you use your Action Surge.

18.name: Improved War Magic
18.description: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

options.name: Rune Knight
options.description: You discover how to enhance your martial prowess using the supernatural power of runes, ancient magic that originated with giants.

3.name: Bonus Proficiencies
3.description: You gain proficiency with smith's tools, and you learn to speak, read, and write Giant.

3.name: Rune Carver
3.description: You learn to use runes to enhance your gear with magic.

options.name: Cloud Rune
options.description: This rune emulates the deceptive magic used by some cloud giants.

options.name: Fire Rune
options.description: This rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of fire giants.

options.name: Frost Rune
options.description: This rune's magic evokes the might of frost giants.

options.name: Stone Rune
options.description: This rune's magic channels the judiciousness associated with stone giants.

options.name: Hill Rune
options.description: This rune's magic bestows a resilience associated with hill giants.

options.name: Storm Rune
options.description: This rune's magic allows you to glimpse the future like a storm giant seer.

3.name: Giant's Might
3.description: You learn to imbue yourself with the might of giants.

7.name: Runic Shield
7.description: You learn to invoke your rune magic to protect your allies.

10.name: Great Stature
10.description: The magic of your runes permanently alters you.

15.name: Master of Runes
15.description: You can invoke each rune you know twice between rests.

18.name: Runic Juggernaut
18.description: You learn to maximize your rune-enhanced size and power.
